FuncDef:
The dn-bit-check disable command disables a device from checking the DN bit in LSAs.
The undo dn-bit-check disable command enables a device to check the DN bit in LSAs. The dn-bit-check disable command disables a device from checking the DN bit in LSAs. The undo dn-bit-check disable command enables a device to check the DN bit in LSAs. By default, the DN bit in LSAs is checked.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the DN bit in ASE LSAs is not checked.
-

Indicates that the DN bit in NSSA LSAs is not checked.
-

Indicates that the DN bit in summary LSAs is not checked.
-

Specifies the router ID of a device on which the DN bit in summary LSAs is checked.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
To prevent routing loops, the OSPF/OSPFv3 multi-instance process uses a bit as the flag bit, which is called the DN bit.
In a VPN Option A scenario, the local PE imports BGP routes to generate LSAs and advertises the LSAs to the remote PE. According to the standard protocol, the peer PE cannot calculate the route because the DN bit is suppressed. In this case, you can run the dn-bit-check disable command to disable the peer PE from checking the DN bit during route calculation.
